Old but gold, even to this day a great game with amazing story, gameplay and well integrated puzzles. Allthough considering this game is nearly 20 years old it would be time for the price to go down a bit.
Half-Life 3 have to be !!

Story
You, Dr. Freeman are a theoretical physicist who one day screws up at work and opens a rift to another dimension. Next thing you know you have to crowbar yourself through a facility to find a way to escape or stop the invasion. Yes, this is the plot. Sadly there is not so much lore that you actually get told. Though the plot is very deep, especially towards the ending, you do not know exactly what is going on all the time and just follow your path clueless.

Gameplay
Since Half-life runs on the source engine, you might be familiar with its controls and gameplay. The game is a nice mix between shooting stuff and solving puzzles and trying desperately to find out how to get further. Sometimes this can be extremely frustrating and I once stopped playing it for about 6 months before picking it up again. On the other hand you feel really smart when you do not get stuck for an hour. One small uncomfortable thing is switching weapons, because in order to do that you must klick to confirm your weapon switch.

Graphics
As you already saw in the screenshots above, the game is older and thus does by far not come up with modern graphics, models, animations or other. It will not bother you, but if you are used to modern games with high end graphics you might miss many details.

Bugs
One time a gate did not open, even though it should have. It took me a while until I realised that, but the best way to solve this problem is to simply use the console command noclip and fly through it.

The game is a classic and I recommend you playing it, since his sequels are even better and when half-life 3 comes out one day and you want to play it, why not play the other ones too. Maybe do not buy it for 10€, rather think of buying it in a bundle when it is on sale.

After 20 years, Half-Life is still worth the money. If you can't afford it, wait for a sale. Do anything in your power to purchase this game. Lol in all seriousness, however, Half-Life is one of my favorite games of all time. The game itself is still great 20 years later. The combat is pretty good for the age and the lore behind it is fun to get into. Also, the community is fantastic. It's kind of the gift that keeps on giving. There are so many mods available to play that the purchase is definately worth it.

Great late 90s, early 2000s series. I played it much, much later, but still was fun playing a game years after it was state of the art. Holds up pretty well, still difficult in areas. I remember playing this at a buddies in high school and being creeped out by the monsters.

This game is great, very immersive and fucking awesome.

A Classic. Perfect in most ways.

Although, the security guard bug (where the guard, who may not die, refuses to open the second door that leads to the parking area) at the end of Surface Tension needs to be fixed.

Note: I played the Half-Life: Source version, which was a mistake.

Half-Life is probably one of the best FPS games in the history of FPS games, and in some ways, I even like this game more than its sequel (even though yes, Half-Life 2 in its own right is ground breaking). 

Half-Life (and the series in general) has such a rich atmosphere that I love so much. The gun play in this game, while a little outdated, is still really fun. The story is captivating, the monsters and interesting and unique, and it's just good fun to have.

Even though I really enjoyed this game, there is some parts of the game that I really got me irritated, like repetitive gameplay and the difficulty. Maybe I'm just really bad at videogames, but the Xen chapters made me want to gouge my eyes out do to its difficulty. Those Alien Controllers are probably the worst thing about this entire game.

Nonetheless, I still really enjoyed this game and I would like anyone that has never played it before hand to just try it. You will not regret it at all.
A great classic with still some revelance today. Graphics might lack luster but gameplay is on point to this day.

The looks might not be what they were, but the personality still rocks.

Punto. Non ci sarebbe bisogno di aggiungere altro. Pietra miliare della storia videoludica; best VG evah, ecc, ecc... Nessuno lo mette in dubbio. Ma recuperarlo oggi? Cosa significa per un gamer di oggi approcciarsi a questo titolo? Dirò la mia, trovandomi proprio in quella fase mistica della vita in cui si decide di recuperare tutto il vecchiume "importante" (saghe storiche come Half-life, Deus ex, Final fantasy, ecc) anziché dedicarsi a titoli anonimi odierni. Sottolineo quindi come "l'effetto girella" sia del tutto assente, non avendolo mai giocato in passato in nessuna forma.


- comparto tecnico (ovviamente) deludente
- storytelling debole (si lo so, all'epoca era avanti anni luce, oggi è arcaico. #stacce)
- gameplay meh
- puzzle e platform un po' troppo predominanti e senza una vera "scintilla"
- nemici sicuramente interessanti, ma non abbastanza
- boss fight ridicola
- noia, noia, noia... 


Si salva, ovviamente, la storia in sé che, lo si capisce già da questo primo capitolo, è davvero intrigante, ed essendomi già spoilerato qualcosa dei titoli successivi ne ho avuto la conferma. Il modo in cui viene raccontata però è davvero troppo deludente oggi, sorry


Quindi lo sconsiglierei? Difficile rispondere a questa domanda. Intendiamoci: il gioco in sé è una palla. Vi romperete le balle a portarlo avanti (personalmente  l'ho finito in 24 ore, davvero tante IMHO, di cui almeno 15 di noia) e sarete probabilmente tentati dal dropparlo o guardarvi semplicemente un gameplay sul tubo. Tuttavia è innegabile come abbia realmente fatto la storia, e la trama su cui è basato è sicuramente valida e meritevole di spenderci del tempo. Se non altro perchè credo l'unico modo per godersi TUTTA la storia di Half-life sia cominciare necessariamente da questo. Io ho deciso di farlo, e sono sicuro che alla fine di questo lungo percorso (HL, HL Opposing force, HL Blue shift, HL2, HL2 ep1 ed ep2) sarò contento di non essermi tirato indietro. 

Ma se siete dell'idea che un videogame debba prima di tutto divertirvi... beh, probabilmente sarà  molto meglio girare al largo. O forse partire da HL2 e recuperare quei pezzi di trama mancanti su Wikipedia)


--------
* aggiungo questa postilla per chiarire un concetto importante: HL non è palloso perchè è vecchio. È palloso perchè è geneticamente così. Gioco ancora oggi, giusto per restare in ambito FPS, a titoli come Doom o Blood traendone il massimo godimento (anzi, preferendoli a molti titoli moderni), La loro formula è un'alchimia perfetta che, semplicemente, funziona oggi come allora, in barba a qualsiasi grafica iperpompata odierna. Half-life no.

This game is beautiful. I consider it a classic though some might argue it isn't. It is a 1998 game so don't expect high poly graphics. If you like FPS games and puzzle games, this game if for you. There is also a multiplayer gamemode but you may want to host your own server and invite your friends to join. Overall I really enjoyed this game and it is definitely worth playing.

Acabo de terminar este juego y tengo que reconocerle que entiendo por qué la gente lo flipa con esta saga, estoy deseando empezar con la segunda parte. La única pega que puedo sacarle es que no sé muy bien por qué se me hace pesado de jugar, disfruto sesiones cortas pero acabo hasta las narices si juego una hora seguida. Supongo que será porque no estoy curtido en clásicos. El juego en general es una compra segura siempre que estés preparado para una experiencia y una filosofía de juego de su época, pero para ser justos vamos a hacer una lista de pros y contras generales (destaco que he jugado la versión normal sin ningún mod ni paquete de texturas):


[u]PROS[/u]
[list]
    [*]Buen diseño de niveles, te incita a pensar antes de actuar.
    [*]Buena atmósfera e historia en general, sobre todo tirando al final del juego.
    [*]Variedad en las armas, todas tienen un funcionamiento muy distinto (esto sí que ha cambiado en los últimos años a peor).
    [*]Doblado íntegramente a castellano (salvo el texto que está dentro de texturas, pero a quién le importa).
    [*]Los enemigos se distinguen muy bien por su sonido y efectos, es algo que siempre se agradece.
[/list]

[u]CONTRAS[/u]
[list]
    [*]El plataformeo es sencillamente horrible, lo siento pero las cosas como son, no hay dios que caiga a la primera en una plataforma delgada (ni gruesa).
    [*]El autoguardado se activa cuando se activa, así que si vas a hacer un salto sobre vacío mejor guarda tú mismo si no te apetece repetir medio capítulo.
    [*]Hasta que te acostumbras no está muy claro con qué puedes interactuar y con qué no, por lo menos yo tengo ese recuerdo.
    [*]Aunque es un caso muy raro, a veces puede fallar un script y como haga mucho que no has guardado o hayas guardado después del error, te tocará repetir desde el último autoguardado. A mí personalmente me pasó contra Gonarch.

Das Spiel ist gut.

In jedem Fall ist es ein Meilenstein in der Computerspielgeschichte, das auch heute noch (meinetwegen in der Remastered Version Source) ein guter FPS ist.

Es gibt auch ein paar Dinge, die mir nicht so gefallen haben, andererseits ist das Spiel so gut gemacht, dass es auch heute noch richtig viel Spaß macht.

Die Gegner sind eine Herausforderung. Die KI ist recht gut. Es gibt kleine, schnelle, starke, gut geschützte und fiese Gegner. Fies, weil einige aus dem Nichts spwanen. Teils technisch bedingt, teils vermutlich storytechnisch im Rahmen des "erlaubten", aber allzuoft wird man einfach beim ersten mal davon überrascht, von wo man unter Beschuss genommen wird. Die Waffen, mit denen man sich wehren kann, sind vielfältig und haben sogar oft Primär- und Sekundärfeuer, was einem das Leben erleichtert. Manchmal sollte man richtig tricky vorgehen und manche Gegner nicht frontal angreifen. Eine geeignete Lösung einer brenzligen Situation ist nicht immer leicht erkennbar.

Das Tempo ist hoch, unser Held, Gordon Freeman, rennt immer (es sei denn, man befiehlt ihm, langsam zu laufen), wesewegen man schnell vorankommt, ohne dass einem ein Finger wehtun muss. Die Steuerung ist fast hervorragend. Die Bewegungsrichtung wird mit der Maus vorgegeben, wie es in modernen Spielen üblich ist. Schlecht finde ich, dass Gordon sich bewegt, als liefe er auf Eis, d.h. er schlittert immer noch etwas weiter, obwohl die Taste schon losgelassen wurde. Eine exakte Steuerung, z.B. bei Sprüngen, die in manchen Passagen nötig wäre, ist so erschwert. Zudem gibt es haklige Situationen, besonders beim Überwinden halbhoher Hindernisse, wo man oft mehrere Versuche braucht, bis es klappt.

Neben der Aufgabe, Gegner zu beseitigen, muss man auch noch Knöpfe drücken, Kisten schieben, Portale in der richtigen Reihenfolge betreten, u.ä. Die Rätsel sind nicht sonderlich schwer, aber immerhin zeigen sie, dass Half-Life kein reiner Shooter sein will, sondern auch etwas Adventure enthält.

Eine Geschichte gibt es auch. OK, sie ist nicht so tiefgründig, aber immerhin ein Anfang (in die richtige Richtung). Wir erfahren davon in geskripteten Sequenzen (keine Cutscenes), in denen Wissenschaftler mit uns reden.

Die Grafik ist (aus heutiger Sicht) schlicht, aber nicht schlecht. Die Anzahl der Polygone ist halt gering und die Texturen verschwommen. Mehr war halt damals nicht drin. Dem Shooter-Erlebnis tut es aber keinen Abbruch.

Ich fand 2/3 des Spiels sehr unterhaltsam. Die Level und die Aufgaben waren abwechslungsreich. Ab dem Lamda-Kern fand ich den Schwierigkeitsgrad aber zu hoch. Ein falscher Schritt genügt dann oft schon, um in einen Abgrund zu stürzen, während Horden von Aliens einen attackieren. Manche würden sagen, da wird es erst richtig interessant und trennt die Könner (wie sie es sind) von dem einfachen Spieler-Volk. Ich gehöre wohl zu letzterem, obwohl ich viele andere FPS (Unreal, Crysis, etc.) durchspielen konnte.

Das macht das Spiel nicht automatisch schlecht, mir wäre es aber lieber gewesen, wenn die Schwierigkeit nicht ganz so hoch getrieben worden wäre.

Nicht zu vergessen ist das hervorragende Speichersystem mit automatischem Speichern an Kontrollpunkten, Quicksave und explizitem Speichern. So kann man immer auf ältere Speicherpunkte zurückgreifen, wenn man nicht weiterkommt.

Sehr gut ist auch (nicht immer selbstverständlich), dass man die Tasten umbelegen kann.

Pro & Contra:

+ Sehr gutes FPS-Erlebnis
+ (Heute noch) akzeptable Grafik
+ Gutes Speichersystem
+ Fast sehr gute Steuerung

- Es wird zum Ende hin sehr (zu?) schwer
- Die Bewegung ist wie auf einer Eisbahn (man gleitet nach)

Wertung: 08/10

Ein guter FPS, ein Klassiker, ein Meilenstein, dessen Schwierigkeitsgrad ich zum Ende hin als zu hoch empfand, wesewegen ich ihm nicht alle 10 Punkte gebe, aber dennoch auf jeden Fall empfehlen kann. Selbst heute noch macht Half-Life viel Spaß.

I love this game. You are in control of the character the entire time, even in the so called "cutscenes". Ok, so the graphichs and shooting mechanics have aged a bit. But compared to the sequel, I'd probably say that I enjoyed this one more. The atmosphere is great and believable. In modern day it's sooo hard to describe what it does well as most other games these days do it as well. But this game just masters the techniques. Plus without this game you wouldn't be praying to lord Gaben 20 times a day.

Of course their are a few things wrong. The alien world at the end of the game is cool at first because of how alien it is and fits well with the creatures you'd been encountering. After that it goes downhill. If memory serves right, one of the bosses was made literally on the joke "what if we gave a testicle legs?". The shooting mechanics in this game are really at their most basic when played today. And the soundtrack isn't something to sing about and can feel out of place.

This is still one of the greatest games out there and if you don't have this classic right now, I don't want to know you anymore.

I just finished my first playthrough of the game, and I loved it! The Gold Source engine really hasn't aged gracefully, and while some mechanics are a little messy (pushing boxes was a nightmare) Half-Life still manages to outdo a lot of modern shooters, even after almost 2 decades.

The pacing, uninterrupted gameplay and immersion was beautifully done, combined with creative levels and some pretty terrifying polygon enemies.

A ver... Este juego es simplemente fantabuloso. A pesar de sus graficos bastante, bastante antiguos y en cierta forma desagradables, es un juego que deberias tener en tu biblioteca, es cierto que no lo jugue en su dia y que es una leyenda que no necesita mas "publicidad", pero en serio, es bastante barato y te asegura unas cuantas horas de diversión.

+ PROS:
   +No necesita practicamente nada en cuanto a potencia.
   +Tiene una historia simple pero atractiva.
   +Su diseño de niveles y entornos es brillante.
   +Enemigos balanceados y jefes entretenidos.
   +Armas variadas que te obligan a cambiar tu estilo de juego.
   +La ambientacion. Black Mesa me parece logica y nunca me ha disgustado.

- CONTRAS:
   -En determinados momentos la solucion para avanzar no es clara.
   -Al moverte pareces tener "pies de mantequilla".
   -Los graficos, si eres uno de esos sucios que se centran solo en ello ¬¬
System Requirements are too high, my rig gets a solid 8fps at lowest settings. The only game that gets lower frames than this is solitaire.

Half Life gave me an experience like no other.

Just the opening was enough to give me goosebumps.

The Storyline was so good, I can't think of anything else that can rival it.

The Gameplay, easy to pickup, but hard to master in multiplayer.

The Atmosphere, one of the greatest I've ever experienced, truly unforgettable.

The AI, actually very smart, they cornered me so mant times, I can't even count.

Half Life Is truly one of the Greatest games in History.

It deserves to go down as such.

Buy this game, if you don't, You're missing out.

I went into Half-Life blind, without nostalgia (partly because when it came out I was but a sperm). I can't say anything that hasn't already been said times and times over. This is a strong start of one of the most influential and iconic series in gaming. Gripping, somewhat surreal, suspenseful, action-packed and extremely well designed, this is one of those games you MUST play, even if the graphics aren't fancy by the modern standards. What's more, completing it enhances the experience from all of the following games in the series (let's take a moment to pray for HL3). Welcome to Black Mesa!
its a good game, but an unsatisfying ending. I guess that was good for 1998

Damn, this is the best shooter I've ever played. 

I don't have any nostalgia for this and I'm not even a big fan of shooters, but this game is so well made that I can't do anything but praise it. 

Sure it might not have aged that well visually but the atmosphere and uniqe look of the game shines through after all these years. The gameplay is what you might expect from a shooter, you shoot things with guns. However when it's combined with the amazing level design, varied and interesting enemies and the sense of isolation this game is rising above every shooter on the market by a mile.

"HAVE A VERY SAFE DAY AT BLACK MESA!"

I get shot:

I am in reactor:

BEEP! BEEP! "WARNING, HAZERDOUS RADIATION LEVELS DETECTED!"

I fall off ledge: 

BEEP! BEEP! "WARNING, MINOR FRACTURE DETECTED!"

I get realy beat up:

BEEP! BEEP! BEEP! "WARNING, USER DEATH IMMINENT!"

Conclusion: I have not lived up to the suit's expectations. =<

Half-Life is an AMAZING game, it has good controls, a good environment, and a good atmosphere. This is a piece of history that MUST be played. You'll need to ration your supplies in order to survive, so never fire a shot unless you are sure it will hit, there is a room in a later chapter that you need someone to get you in, and there is a ton of ammo in there, but that is the only big find in the game. This game, for its age, can be suspensful at times, and can be scary on hard mode, after a certain chapter, I never trusted WATER in the game anymore. This is a must buy, even if you are not a fan of these types of games. Trust me, this game is  worth every penny!

Çoklu oyuncu modunda uzun zamanlar geçirdiğim , internet kafelerde saatler harcamama neden olan oyunu yıllar sonra single modunu oynamak için yükledim ve ilk defa senaryo modunu oynadım.Şu an için bile harikulade bir ilerleyişi var oyunun.Çıktığı zaman devrim yapmasına şaşmamak gerek.Grafikler eski ancak grafik motoru harika.Güzel bir nostalji yaşattı bana.
